intro: Psychotria xanthocephala, commonly known as the yellow-headed psychotria, is a tropical flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers with red stamens. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its leaves are alternate, elliptical, and have a glossy texture. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
